intro: Dipteris lobbiana var. ridleyi, commonly known as the Ridley's water fern, is a variant of the water fern genus Dipteris. It is a small, aquatic fern typically found in slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant has finely divided, pinnately compound leaves that are often submerged or floating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, contributing to its ecological role in aquatic ecosystems.
